column4: can i install oracle using apt-get install command in Ubuntu 8.04
No you can't
then how can i?
Do you want to use it with php?
or standalone?
then you will have to download it from oracle website
you need oracle 10g express edition or 11g?
any one can do
i tried to download it
what is your ram capacity?
use express edition then
go to http://www.oracle.com/technology/software/products/database/xe/htdocs/102xelinsoft.html
there click the western european debian package download
i tried to download oracle 11g from oracle website but is closed my d4x downloader window
According to your RAM capacity, download 10g express edition
11g will take up a lot of ram
MySQL is very fast also
on http://download.oracle.com/docs/cd/E11882_01/install.112/e10840/pre_install.htm#CHDCEBFF oracle says you need 1GB ram for 11g
ok
and somewhere else on the oracle site (i dont know where) oracle says 512 MB ram is recommended for 10g express
